page.title: 07INDUSTRY IN MENSTRIE.
page.content: The D.C.L was built in 1746 for whisky making. Since then it has expanded greatly also making yeasts, bread and experimental products. The buildings have also expanded greatly now including vats, yeast houses and labs. Pre WW2 production turned entirely to yeasts, the main ingredient being mollasses. Post-war products were extended by the use of autolysed yeast and in 1948 active dried yeast pellets were brought onto the market. A packing station for this yeast was built in 1962. Recently a new product SPADY (small particle active dried yeast) was introduced.The original copper fermenting vats have been replaced by stainless-steel ones and more fermenters have been introduced. The fermenter house is being replaced to bring it up to the required levels.
